required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of Physical Exercise Program on Fetoplacental Growth
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of Physical Exercise Program on Fetoplacental Growth: a Randomized Controlled Trial

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this study is to examine the effect of a supervised physical exercise program during pregnancy on fetoplacental growth.

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in maternal gestational weight
primary_outcome.description: Maternal weight gain during pregnancy. Weight will be measured at the beginning and at the end of the pregnancy

secondary_outcome.measure: Pregestational weight and Body Mass Index (BMI)

secondary_outcome.description: Size and height, head circumference and body mass index of the baby
Apgar score will be valued 1 and 5 minutes after delivery
Type of labor, stage and duration of labor
The level of maternal depression after delivery will be measured with the Edinburgh Postnatal Depression Scale (EPDS)

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes from baseline in prenatal depression
secondary_outcome.description: The level of maternal depression during pregnancy will be measured at the beginning and at the end of the pregnancy, as well as at 8 weeks postpartum, with the Center for Epidemiologic Studies Depression Scale (CES-D)

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes from baseline in maternal quality of life
secondary_outcome.description: Maternal quality of life will be measured at the beginning and at the end of the pregnancy, as well as at 8 weeks postpartum, with the Short Form-36 Health Survey (SF-36)

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes from baseline in urinary incontinence
secondary_outcome.description: Urinary incontinence will be measured at the beginning and at the end of the pregnancy, as well as at 8 weeks postpartum, with the International Consultation on Incontinence Questionnaire Short-Form (ICIQ-SF)
Gestational diabetes will be measured with the O' Sullivan's test

arm_group.description: Pregnant women not participating in supervised physical exercise program. The subjects in this group will be monitored during pregnancy to know if they make any kind of exercise on your own, to know which are really sedentary pregnant women.
Pregnant women participating in supervised physical exercise program.

intervention.description: Supervised physical conditioning program of three 55—60 minute sessions per week during whole pregnancy (before week 16 to 38). Each session consists of 25-30 minutes of cardiovascular exercise,10 minutes of specific exercises (strength and balance exercises), and 10 minutes of pelvic floor muscles training. Aerobic activity was prescribed at light to moderate intensity, aiming for 55-60% of heart rate reserve. All subjects wore a heart rate (HR) monitor (Polar FT7) during the training sessions to ensure that exercise intensity was light to moderate.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Being healthy and able to exercise following American College of Obstetricians and Gynecologists (ACOG) guidelines
- Being able to communicate in spanish
- Giving birth at Hospital Universitario de Torrejón, Hospital Universitario de Puerta de Hierro or Hospital Universitario Severo Ochoa (Madrid)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Multiparity
- Obstetrician complications
- Being interested in the study after 18 weeks
- Not having availability to attend to the physical exercise program
- Younger than 18 years old
- Older than 45 years old

link.description: Website that provides information about our research group projects
